title: 105_hr3143
content: The Act titled "Comprehensive Holocaust Accountability in Insurance Measure" prohibits certain foreign insurance companies. The Act titled "Comprehensive Holocaust Accountability in Insurance Measure" prohibits listed foreign insurance companies from conducting business in the United States unless they disclose financial dealings with individuals on Holocaust survivor lists. The Act prohibits listed foreign insurance companies from operating in the US unless they disclose financial dealings with individuals on Holocaust survivor lists, including companies like Assicurazioni Generali S.p.A., Union Des Assurances de Paris, and others. The Attorney General will designate an office in the Department of Justice for disclosures regarding financial dealings with Holocaust survivors. The office will take appropriate action to make these disclosures public. SEC. 201. LIMITATION ON INSURED DEPOSITORY INSTITUTIONS. Prohibition on transactions with certain insurance companies or their affiliates by insured depository institutions under Section 18 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act. Prohibition on transactions with certain insurance companies or their affiliates by insured depository institutions under Section 18 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act. Limited exception for affiliates of foreign insurance companies described in paragraph (1) of section 101(b) of the Comprehensive Holocaust Accountability in Insurance Measure. The Federal Deposit Insurance Act prohibits insured depository institutions from engaging in transactions with certain insurance companies or their affiliates. However, there is a limited exception for affiliates of foreign insurance companies as described in the Comprehensive Holocaust Accountability in Insurance Measure. This exception allows for the payment of dividends or investment of additional capital in the insured depository institution by the foreign insurance company or its affiliate, subject to regulations set by the Attorney General or the appropriate Federal banking agency. LIMITATION ON UNINSURED BRANCHES, AGENCIES, AND COMMERCIAL LENDING COMPANY AFFILIATES OF FOREIGN BANKS. Section 7 of the International Banking Act of 1978 is amended to prohibit certain transactions with foreign insurance companies or their affiliates. This includes restrictions on accepting deposits, providing payment services, participating in payment systems, extending credit, and engaging in financial activities with listed foreign insurance companies. The Attorney General can restrict transactions with foreign insurance companies or their affiliates for a specific period after the enactment of the Comprehensive Holocaust Accountability in Insurance Measure. There is a limited exception for affiliates of foreign insurance companies controlled by a foreign bank. The Attorney General can restrict transactions with foreign insurance companies or their affiliates, including payment of dividends or investment of additional capital, subject to regulations set by relevant authorities.
